channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2598] GOP Rep Wilson Yells Out "Lie" During Obama Health Care Spee
item.description: During President Obama's speech to a joint session of Congress tonight regarding health care reform, Republican Congressman Joe Wilson (R-S.C.) yelled out "you lie" when the President said his health care bill would not mandate coverage for illegal immigrants. WATCH:

item.title: [+2336] Proof That Rep. Wilson's "You Lie!" Was A Lie
item.description: During President Obama's speech, Rep. Joe Wilson (R-SC) shouted "you lie!" when President Obama insisted his plan would not provide health coverage to illegal immigrants. In reality, Rep. Wilson is the liar...

item.title: [+2266] OMG!! BEER GOGGLE FAIL -BigTime [pic]
item.description: Keeping AA in business, one kiss at a time. Oh isn't Romance just beautiful when it comes.........................

item.title: [+1496] Google Logo on 09/09/09 09:09:09
item.description: Furthermore, if you’d looked at Google’s (Google) homepage at exactly 09:09:09, you’d notice another new Google logo, which appeared only briefly; it was the same as the regular Google logo, but with inscription 09/09/09 09:09:09 added below.

item.title: [+1480] Obama speech disrupter a health industry darling: $240k
item.description: In fact, over his entire congressional career, health professionals represent Wilson’s top industry contributors, donating a total of $244,196 to his campaign, according to the Center for Responsive Politics OpenSecrets.org database. He received another $86,150 from pharmaceutical companies, $73,050 from insurance firms and $68,000 from hospitals.

item.title: [+1333] Is the World getting better or worse?
item.description: By most measures, living standards are improving across the World, and though hundreds of millions of people live in desperate conditions, things are moving in the right direction. Less encouragingly, the environment is clearly in trouble and armed conflict remains a major problem. [infographic]

item.title: [+1219] The Tallest Abandoned Structures on Earth
item.description: Today, we’re going to do some urban exploring as we’re searching for the tallest abandoned structures around the world. We’re going to visit Russia, North Korea, the US and Poland on our quest for the rustiest. Once found, we’re going to climb the towers and buildings so make sure you leave your vertigo behind…

item.title: [+1119] The Timeless Wisdom of Danny Devito (PICS)
[+1087] Hubble telescope's latest images (PICS)
item.description: A refurbished U.S. space telescope is showing Earth the sharpest photos yet of cosmic beauty, complete with heavenly glows. NASA on Wednesday unveiled the first deep space photos taken by the Hubble telescope since its billion dollar repair mission earlier this year.

item.title: [+809] Microsoft Confirms "Yep, we Teach Best Buy to Trash Linux"
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed the authenticity of a controversial set of training slides that it prepared to train Best Buy employees in what the software giant calls "the important differences between Linux computers and Windows computers."

item.title: [+802] 13 Things That Don't Make Sense in Science
item.description: Strive as we might to make sense of the world, there are mysteries that still confound us. Michael Brooks presents thirteen of the most perplexing. Cracking any one of them could yield profound truths.

item.title: [+768] Bing Loves The Porn Hounds
item.description: One thing about Bing really stands out – it may be the best porn search engine ever created (see Badda-Bing Indeed).

item.title: [+739] 21 Great Photography Shots [And How They Took Them]
item.description: Here are some great photography shots by different photographers, and they tell you how they took them.

item.title: [+725] 4th Grader's Response to President Obama's Speech [Video]
item.description: This is 9 year old Sarah's response to President Obama's speech to students, shared on September 8, 2009.

item.title: [+637] Monty Python Reuniting (for 1 Night)!
item.description: Disbanded but hardly forgotten, sublimely ridiculous comedy troupe Monty Python (pictured above) gets a fresh influx of showbiz love over the next couple of months.

item.title: [+615] That's right, smile for the cameras... [PIC]
[+612] 'Anonymous' Hackers Declare War on Australia
item.description: Anonymous has struck again -- this time declaring war on Australia. Hackers identifying themselves as Anonymous launched a denial-of-service attack.

item.title: [+590] Guaranteed Health Care In Iraq - But Not For You
item.description: You'd better sit down, folks. Article 31 of the Iraqi Constitution, drafted by your right-wing Bushies in 2005 and ratified by the Iraqi people, includes state-guaranteed (single payer) healthcare for life for every Iraqi citizen.

item.title: [+574] Praying Mantis Catches a Hummingbird
item.description: Don’t ever mess with a praying mantis.

item.title: [+551] Scientists have now levitated mice using magnetic fields
item.description: Scientists working on behalf of NASA built a device to simulate variable levels of gravity. It consists of a superconducting magnet that generates a field powerful enough to levitate the water inside living animals.
